subclass.name: Warrior of the Living Weapon
subclassFeatures: Warrior of the Living Weapon|Monk|XPHB|Living Weapon|ExploringEberron24|3

subclass.name: College of the Dirge Singer
subclassFeatures: College of the Dirge Singer|Bard|XPHB|Dirge Singer|ExploringEberron24|3

subclassFeature.name: Warrior of the Living Weapon
entries: {@i Reshape Your Body for Battle}

Warriors of the Living Weapon pursue physical perfection, honing their body as a smith sharpens a sword. Their traditions are drawn from cultures of shape-shifters and creatures who fight with tooth and claw.

subclassFeature.name: Martial Form
entries: At the start of your turn, you can expend 1 Focus Point to manifest your martial form. The form lasts for 10 minutes, until you use this feature again, or until you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition. Choose one of the following options when you adopt the form.

entries.name: Forged Heart
entries: Whenever you hit an object with an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, the hit is a {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB}. In addition, whenever you hit a creature with an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} granted by Flurry of Blows, the target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 15 feet directly away from you.

entries.name: Nightmare Shroud
entries: When you use Deflect Attacks, the attacking creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the end of its next turn.

entries.name: Traveler's Blade
entries: Your reach increases by 10 feet.

entries.name: Weretouched
entries: When you reduce an enemy within 5 feet of you to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, you gain {@variantrule Temporary Hit Points|XPHB} equal to one roll of your Martial Arts die plus your Monk Level.

subclassFeature.name: Mutable Strike
entries: You have the power to alter your natural weapons, growing claws or reinforcing your fists. Whenever you deal damage with your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, it can deal your choice of Bludgeoning, Piercing, or Slashing damage.

subclassFeature.name: Manifest Blow
entries: You gain one of the following options of your choice.

entries.name: Forged Heart
entries: Once per turn when you hit a creature with an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can deal extra damage of the same type equal to one roll of your Martial Arts die.

entries.name: Nightmare Shroud
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can expend 2 Focus Points to cause psychic energy to erupt from you. When you do so, each creature of your choice in a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes Psychic damage equal to three rolls of your Martial Arts die, and has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the end of your next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage.

entries.name: Traveler's Blade
entries: Once per turn when you hit a creature with an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, you can use both the {@variantrule Damage|XPHB} and the Grapple option. You are always considered to have a free hand when determining whether you can Grapple another creature.

entries.name: Weretouched
entries: When you hit the same creature twice on your turn with {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} you can expend up to 3 Focus Points to deal extra damage on your second hit. The damage equals a number of rolls of your Martial Arts die equal to the Focus Points expended, and is the same type as your triggering {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Reflexive Adaptation
entries: When you use Self-Restoration, the following conditions are added to the list of conditions you can remove: {@condition Blinded|XPHB}, {@condition Deafened|XPHB}, and {@condition Grappled|XPHB}.

In addition, when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB} you can remove 1 level of {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} from yourself and when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} you can remove all levels of {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} from yourself.

subclassFeature.name: Perfect Form
entries: Whenever you assume your Martial Form, you can expend an additional 3 Focus Points to gain the following benefits for as long as you remain in the form.

entries.name: Mercurial Strikes
entries: Whenever you attack with an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} granted by Flurry of Blows, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}.

entries.name: Regeneration
entries: At the start of your turn, roll one Martial Arts die. You regain that many {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

entries.name: Unbreakable Body
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to your {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: College of the Dirge Singer
entries: {@i Bolster your Allies with Story and Song}

Students of both history and war, Dirge Singer Bards use tales of past glory to inspire their allies and provide keen strategic insight, directing their comrades to strike when enemies are weak. This college was born in the Empire of Dhakaan, but over the course of the Last War, Cyre developed its own version of these techniques, and now Bards that follow this path keep the memory of their fallen nation alive through song.

subclassFeature.name: Broad Inspiration
entries: You know how to strengthen the hearts of your troops and stir them to greatness. You learn the {@spell Guidance|XPHB} cantrip, which counts as a Bard spell for you. The cantrip doesn't count against your number of cantrips known.
Additionally, when you confer a Bardic Inspiration die to a creature, you can also confer that Bardic Inspiration die to a second creature within range.

subclassFeature.name: Keeper of History
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill History|XPHB} and {@skill Performance|XPHB} skills. If you already have these proficiencies, you instead gain {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Commanding Voice
entries: You excel at inspiring and directing soldiers in battle. When you take the {@action Attack|XPHB} action or the {@action Magic|XPHB} action on your turn, two creatures of your choice who possess one of your Bardic Inspiration die can expend it to use their {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to immediately make one attack with a weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, adding the Bardic Inspiration die to the attack's damage roll on a hit.

subclassFeature.name: Battle Hymn
entries: You unflaggingly maintain the spirits and discipline of your unit. As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can start a Battle Hymn which can be heard by all creatures within 60 feet. The hymn lasts until the start of your next turn. While the hymn is active, whenever an ally within 30 feet who can hear you makes an ability check or a saving throw, they can add {@dice 1d4} to the ability check or save.

subclassFeature.name: Circle of the Forged
entries: {@i Shape-shift into Beasts of Steel and Wood}

What is truly natural? The warforged are living creatures, despite being constructed from wood and steel. Druids who embrace the Circle of the Forged explore the potential of the warforged form, blending animal shapes with warforged durability. Only a handful of Druids follow this Circle. Did you learn these techniques from a mentor? Are you driven by instinct, still learning what you're capable of? Or, if you're a Warforged, were you designed with the potential to assume multiple forms... and if so, who created you, and why?

subclassFeature.name: Skin of Steel
entries: You can channel the power of the forge when you assume a Wild Shape form, granting you the benefits below.

entries.name: Challenge Rating
entries: The maximum {@variantrule Challenge Rating|XPHB} for the form equals your Druid level divided by 3 (round down).

entries.name: Armor Class
entries: Until you leave the form, your AC equals 15 plus your Wisdom modifier if that total is higher than the Beast's AC.

entries.name: Construct Resilience
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Poison damage. You also have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws to avoid or end the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition.

entries.name: Tireless
entries: You don't gain {@condition Exhaustion|XPHB} levels from dehydration, malnutrition, or suffocation. In addition, you don't need to sleep, and magic can't put you to sleep.

entries.name: Obvious
entries: While in a Wild Shape form, your body is made from the same materials as a warforged; your muscles are rootlike tendrils, and they're protected by armored plates. It's obvious to an observer that you are not a normal animal.

subclassFeature.name: Circle of the Forged Spells
entries: When you reach a Druid level specified in the Circle of the Forged Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Elementally Imbued
entries: While in a Wild Shape form, you gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Elemental Strikes
entries: Each of your attacks in a Wild Shape form can deal its normal damage type, Acid damage, Cold damage, Fire damage, or Lightning damage. You make this choice each time you hit with those attacks.

entries.name: Elemental Cascade
entries: Choose one of the following damage types: Acid, Cold, Fire, or Lightning. Once per turn when you hit with a Wild Shape form's attack, you can expend a spell slot (no action required) to deal extra damage of the chosen type equal to {@dice 1d6} per level of the spell slot, to a maximum of {@dice 5d6}. The target must make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, the target suffers an effect based on the chosen damage type for 1 minute. The target repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

entries.name: Acid
entries: The target suffers a penalty to AC equal to half your Wisdom modifier (minimum 1).

entries.name: Cold
entries: The target's {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is 0 and they have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Strength and Dexterity checks.

entries.name: Fire
entries: At the start of each of its turns, the target takes Fire damage equal to your Wisdom modifier.

entries.name: Lightning
entries: The target can't make {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Opportunity Attacks}, and the first attack it makes on each of its turns has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Adamantine Hide
entries: While in a Wild Shape form, you gain {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage.

In addition, when you are hit by an attack roll or forced to make a saving throw, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} and expend a use of Wild Shape to shape-shift into one of your Wild Shape forms.

subclassFeature.name: Construction Perfection
entries: While in a Wild Shape form, you gain the following additional benefits.

entries.name: Armor Class
entries: Until you leave the form, your AC equals 16 plus your Wisdom modifier if that total is higher than the Beast's AC.

entries.name: Iron Mind
entries: You have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Charmed|XPHB}, {@condition Frightened|XPHB}, {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB}, {@condition Petrified|XPHB}, and {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} conditions, and Poison damage.

subclassFeature.name: Mind Domain
entries: {@i Channel Divine Devotion into Psychic Power}

The Mind Domain celebrates the power of the mortal mind, channeling psychic energy to protect the faithful and smite your enemies. While this is most often associated with the Path of Light or the Riedran Path of Inspiration, followers of the daelkyr can also master this power. Visions of Xoriat can drive a priest to madness, but they can also reveal deadly secrets of the mind.

subclassFeature.name: Mind Domain Spells
entries: Your connection to this divine domain ensures you always have certain spells ready. When you reach a Cleric level specified in the Mind Domain Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Mind Domain Spells
rows: {@spell Command|XPHB}, {@spell Detect Thoughts|XPHB}, {@spell Dissonant Whispers|XPHB}, {@spell Mind Spike|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Psychic Feedback
entries: When a creature you can see within 30 feet of yourself succeeds on a Wisdom saving throw, you can take a {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} and expend a use of your Channel Divinity to impose {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on the saving throw, prying into their mind before they succeed or fail.

subclassFeature.name: Psychic Force
entries: You learn to buffet your foes with mental power. When you cast a Cleric spell that deals Radiant damage, you can choose to have it inflict Psychic damage instead. When you cast a spell that deals Psychic damage, you can add your Charisma modifier to that spell's damage against one of the spell's targets.

subclassFeature.name: Gestalt Anchor
entries: Your mental power increases, allowing you to project a sense of calm in a 10-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} that originates from you. The projection is inactive if you have the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition.
You and your allies in the projection gain a +2 bonus to Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws.
If another Mind Domain Cleric is present, a creature can only benefit from one Gestalt Anchor at a time.

subclassFeature.name: Bend Reality
entries: When an ally you can see within 30 feet of yourself fails a saving throw, you can replace the roll with a 20, potentially changing the outcome. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Forge Adept
entries: {@i Craft a Mighty Weapon out of Your Soul}

The daashor artificers of the Dhakaani Empire were the finest weaponsmiths in Khorvaire's history, as discussed in Uncharted Domains. As a Forge Adept, you carry on these ancient traditions, creating mystical weapons and armor, strengthening allies on the battlefield, and bringing down enemies with weapons imbued with your own soul energy. If you're dar, you learned these techniques from the masters of your clan. Are you content to follow ancient traditions, or do you want to add your own innovations? If you're not Dhakaani, did you learn these techniques from a daashor mentor? Did you steal this knowledge? Or are you replicating these traditions on your own?

subclassFeature.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency with {@item Smith's Tools|XPHB}. If you already have this proficiency, you gain proficiency with one other type of {@item Artisan's Tools|XPHB} of your choice.
In addition, when you craft an ordinary or magic weapon, the amount of time required to craft it is halved.

subclassFeature.name: Forge Adept Spells
entries: When you reach an Artificer level specified in the Forge Adept Spells table, you thereafter always have the listed spells prepared.

entries.caption: Forge Adept Spells
rows: {@spell Armor of Agathys|XPHB}, {@spell Shield of Faith|XPHB}

subclassFeature.name: Battle Ready
entries: Your combat training and your experiments with magic have paid off in two ways:

entries.name: Arcane Empowerment
entries: When you attack with a magic weapon, you can use your Intelligence modifier, instead of Strength or Dexterity, for the attack and damage rolls.

entries.name: Weapon Knowledge
entries: You gain proficiency with Martial weapons. You can use a weapon with which you have proficiency as a {@variantrule Spellcasting Focus|XPHB} for your Artificer spells.

subclassFeature.name: Ghaal'Shaarat
entries: You can imbue a weapon with a fraction of your spirit, creating what the Dhakaani daashors call a ghaal'shaarat, Goblin for "mighty blade." As a Magic action while you have {@item Smith's Tools|XPHB} in hand, you can turn a Simple or Martial Melee weapon into a Ghaal'Shaarat. The weapon continues to be a Ghaal'Shaarat until you imbue a different weapon or you die.
The weapon gains the following benefits while you wield it.

entries.name: Mighty Blade
entries: A nonmagical weapon becomes a magic weapon. You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with the weapon, unless it already had this bonus or a better one.

entries.name: Returning Weapon
entries: The weapon has the {@itemProperty T|XPHB|Thrown} property with a normal range of 30 feet and a long range of 120 feet. It returns to your hand immediately after it is used to make a ranged attack roll.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: You can attack twice instead of once whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Runes of War
entries: You gain the following benefits while wielding your Ghaal'Shaarat.

entries.name: Improved Mighty Blade
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with the weapon, unless it already had this bonus or a better one.

entries.name: Aura of War
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you begin radiating a bolstering aura in a 30-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} that originates from you. Choose one of the following damage types: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Thunder. While in the aura, you and your allies each deal an extra {@damage 1d4} damage of the chosen type when hitting with a weapon attack or {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}. The aura lasts for 1 minute, until you use this feature again, or until you end it (no action required). You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

subclassFeature.name: Perfect Weapon
entries: The connection of your spirit to your weapon has been perfected. You gain the following benefits while wielding your Ghaal'Shaarat.

entries.name: Perfect Mighty Blade
entries: You gain a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with the weapon, unless it already had this bonus or a better one. Additionally, the first time you attack with your Ghaal'Shaarat on your turn, you can transfer some or all of the weapon's bonus to your {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB}. The bonus remains until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Elemental Strike
entries: When you hit a creature with an attack roll using your Ghaal'Shaarat, choose one of the following damage types: Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, or Thunder. Your Ghaal'Shaarat deals an extra {@damage 1d6} damage of the chosen type; and you can cause the weapon to deal the chosen type of damage or its normal damage type.

entries.name: Soul Bound
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Psychic damage, and you have {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} and {@condition Frightened|XPHB} conditions.

subclassFeature.name: Maverick
entries: {@i Craft the Tool You Need in the Moment}

A Maverick Artificer is always tinkering, forever chasing a new idea. Where other Artificers focus on a single path of arcane science, the strength of the Maverick is flexibility. They may lack the discipline or credentials of their scholarly colleagues, but Mavericks have a talent for cobbling together exactly what's needed to solve any problem.

subclassFeature.name: Tool Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency with {@item Tinker's Tools|XPHB}. If you already have proficiency with {@item Tinker's Tools|XPHB}, you gain proficiency with one other type of {@item Artisan's Tools|XPHB} of your choice.
In addition, when you craft a magic item, the amount of time required to craft it is halved.

subclassFeature.name: Maverick Spells
entries: You learn one cantrip of your choice from the Artificer, Cleric, or Wizard spell list. The chosen cantrip counts as an Artificer spell for you, and Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for it.

In addition, any time you prepare Artificer spells, you can prepare an additional number of spells equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}. These additional spells can be chosen from the Artificer, Cleric, and Wizard spells lists, and the chosen spells count as Artificer spells for you.

subclassFeature.name: Arcane Prototype
entries: You're always working on new projects, crafting Arcane Prototypes. You determine a prototype's appearance, but its functionality is always similar to that of a {@item Spell Scroll|XDMG}—it holds the effect of a spell that can be unleashed at a later time. Only you can use a prototype to cast a spell; they're experimental creations that no one else can truly understand.

Your ability to constantly come up with new ideas is represented by Arcane Charges. You have 1 Arcane Charge, and you gain more as you reach higher levels, as shown in the Arcane Charges level of the Arcane Prototypes table. You can't have more Arcane Charges than the number shown in the table for your level. You regain all expended Arcane Charges when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

You can use your Arcane Charges to imbue spells into your prototypes, up to the level shown in the Max Spell Level of the Arcane Prototypes table. While a prototype is in your possession, you can cast the imbued spell without expending a spell slot, without preparing the spell, and without Material components. Casting the spell in this way requires the spell's normal casting time. Once the spell is cast, the prototype crumbles to dust, unless you choose to preserve it by expending a spell slot equal to the level of the spell.

entries.name: Imbuing Spells into your Prototypes
entries: When you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can create a prototype if you have {@item Tinker's Tools|XPHB} in hand. When you reach certain Artificer levels specified in the Artificer Level column of the Arcane Prototypes table, the number of prototypes you can create at the end of a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB} increases.

When you create a prototype, choose a spell from the Artificer, Cleric, or Wizard spell list. This expends a number of Arcane Charges equal to the level of the spell, up to the maximum spell level allowed. For example, if you're a level 9 Artificer, you can create up to 3 prototypes, each with a maximum spell level of 3, expending a total of 5 Arcane Charges to do so; you could create two level 1 prototypes and one level 3 prototype; one level 2 prototype and one level 3 prototype, or one level 1 prototype and two level 2 prototypes.

subclassFeature.name: Fine Tuning
entries: Whenever you cast an Artificer spell while you have {@item Tinker's Tools|XPHB} in your possession, you can add your Intelligence modifier to one damage roll of the spell.

subclassFeature.name: Work in Progress
entries: Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, you can replace one of your prepared spells with a new spell from the Artificer, Cleric, or Wizard spell list. This spell counts as an Artificer spell for you.

subclassFeature.name: Final Breakthrough
entries: Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, you can swap a spell contained in your Prototype for another spell of the same level, chosen from the Artificer, Cleric, or Wizard spell list.
In addition, you ignore all class, species, spell, and level requirements on attuning to or using a magic item.

trait.name: Alien Mind
entries: {@actSave int} {@dc 22}, any creature that tries to read Valaar's thoughts or deals Psychic damage to it. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Stunned|XPHB} condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day, or 5/Day in Lair)
entries: If Valaara fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Valaara has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: Valaara regains 20 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} at the start of each of its turns. If Valaara takes Radiant damage, this trait doesn't function on Valaara's next turn. Valaara dies only if it starts its turn with 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Valaara makes two attacks, using Chitinous Claw or Chitinous Spine in any combination. It also uses Summon Swarms.

action.name: Chitinous Claw
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 14}, reach 5 ft. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d10 + 7}) Slashing damage.

action.name: Chitinous Spine
entries: {@atkr r} {@hit 14}, range 60/180 ft. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d6 + 7}) Piercing damage.

action.name: Summon Swarms
entries: Valaara summons a swarm of insects or arachnids that fills a 10-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} centered on a point Valaara can see within 120 feet, afflicting all creatures in the area with one of the following effects (roll a {@dice 1d6} or choose one), to which Valaara is immune:

items.name: Stinging Wasps
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 22}. {@actSaveFail} 32 ({@damage 5d12}) Piercing damage, and the target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage and the target doesn't have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on attack rolls.

items.name: Spinning Spiders
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 22}. {@actSaveFail} 27 ({@damage 6d8}) Bludgeoning damage. The target has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition until the web is destroyed (AC 10; HP 5; {@variantrule Vulnerability|XPHB} to Fire damage; {@variantrule Immunity|XPHB} to Poison and Psychic damage).

items.name: Venomous Centipedes
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 22}. {@actSaveFail} 22 ({@damage 4d10}) Poison damage and the target has the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition. It repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

items.name: Infesting Grubs
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 22}. {@actSaveFail} The target is infested by 4 ({@dice 1d4 + 2}) rot grubs, taking 3 ({@damage 1d6}) Piercing damage per rot grub at the start of each of its turns. If a target infested with rot grubs ends its turn with 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, the rot grubs burrow into its heart, killing it. Any effect that cures disease kills all rot grubs infesting the target, ending the effect. Applying fire to the bite wound before the end of the creature's next turn deals 1 Fire damage to the creature and kills the rot grubs, ending the effect. After this time, the rot grubs are too far under the skin to be burned.

items.name: Discordant Cicadas
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 22}. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition. At the end of each of its turns, the target repeats the save, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically. While {@condition Frightened|XPHB}, the target has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition. {@actSaveSuccess} The target has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on future saves against this swarm for 24 hours.

action.name: Psychoactive Beetles
entries: {@actSave int} {@dc 22}. {@actSaveFail} 33 ({@damage 6d10}) Psychic damage.

bonus.name: Teleport
entries: Valaara teleports up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

legendary.name: Throw Spine
entries: Valaara makes one Chitinous Spine attack.

legendary.name: Imaginary Crawlers
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 22}, one creature Valaara can see within 60 feet. {@actSaveFail} 22 ({@damage 4d10}) Psychic damage, and the target immediately loses {@status Concentration|XPHB} on any spell it is {@status Concentration|XPHB|Concentrating} on.

legendary.name: Synthesize Worm
entries: Valaara magically fuses the swarms under its command, forming a Carrion Crawler in an unoccupied space they can see within 90 feet of themself. The Carrion Crawler takes its turn immediately after Valaara on the same {@variantrule Initiative|XPHB} count, and it obeys Valaara.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Forest Queen casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 23}, {@hit 15} to hit with spell attacks):

trait.name: Grace of the Forest Queen
entries: As long as the Forest Queen is within the Endless Weald, her AC is 25.

trait.name: Inscrutable
entries: No magic can observe the Forest Queen remotely or detect her thoughts without her permission. Wisdom ({@skill Insight|XPHB}) checks made to ascertain the Forest Queen's intentions or sincerity are made with {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB}.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day, or 5/Day in the Endless Weald)
entries: If the Forest Queen fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Forest Queen has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
entries: The Forest Queen can communicate with Beasts and Plants as if they shared a language.

trait.name: Thelanian Protagonist
entries: If destroyed, the Forest Queen reforms in {@dice 1d4} days, reviving with all her {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. The new body appears in an unoccupied space within the Endless Weald.

trait.name: Woodland Camouflage
entries: The Forest Queen has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth|XPHB}) checks made to hide in wooded terrain.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Forest Queen makes two attacks, using Grasping Vine and Verdant Staff in any combination.

action.name: Grasping Vine
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 15}, reach 40 ft. {@h}26 ({@damage 4d8 + 8}) Bludgeoning damage, and the target has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 23}) from a vine that sprouts from the ground.

action.name: Verdant Staff
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 15}, reach 10 ft. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) Bludgeoning damage plus 21 ({@damage 6d6}) Force damage.

bonus.name: Tree Stride
entries: If within 5 feet of a Large or bigger tree, the Forest Queen teleports to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of a second Large or bigger tree that is within 60 feet of the previous tree.

legendary.name: Bludgeon
entries: The Forest Queen makes a Grasping Vine or Verdant Staff attack.

legendary.name: Crushing Grasp
entries: One creature that is {@condition Grappled|XPHB} by the Forest Queen's Grasping Vine takes 27 ({@damage 5d10}) Bludgeoning damage.

legendary.name: Touch of Nature
entries: The Forest Queen uses Spellcasting to cast a spell of her choice.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Forgotten Prince casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 23}, {@hit 15} to hit with spell attacks):

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (4/Day or 5/Day in Lair)
entries: If the Forgotten Prince fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Forgotten Prince has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Stolen Gifts
entries: At the start of each of his turns, the Forgotten Prince causes one creature he can see within 60 feet to make a {@dc 25} Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB}) check. On a failed check, the Forgotten Prince steals one of the following from the target until the start of the his next turn:

items.name: Weapon Skill
entries: For the duration, the target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on weapon attacks, and the Prince has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on Dark Scythe attacks.

items.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: For the duration, the target has {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on spell attacks, and all creatures have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws made to resist the target's spells. Additionally, all creatures have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on saving throws to resist the Prince's spells.

items.name: Speed
entries: The target's {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is reduced by 20 feet (to a minimum of 5 feet). Additionally, the Prince's {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is increased by 20 feet, and he can take the Disengage action as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}.

trait.name: Thelanian Protagonist
entries: If destroyed, the Forgotten Prince reforms in {@dice 1d4} days, reviving with all his {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. The new body appears in an unoccupied space within the Castle of Forgotten Things.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Forgotten Prince makes two Dark Scythe attacks.

action.name: Dark Scythe
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 15}, reach 10 ft. {@h}29 ({@damage 6d6 + 8}) Necrotic damage.

action.name: Threads of Memory {@recharge 5}
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 23}, up to three creatures the Forgotten Prince can see within 60 feet. {@actSaveFail} 28 ({@damage 8d6}) Psychic damage, and the target's memories are stolen. Until the memories return, the target subtracts 2 ({@dice 1d4}) from all {@dice D20} Tests. It repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

bonus.name: Fey Step
entries: The Forgotten Prince can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space he can see.

bonus.name: Shadow Stealth
entries: The Forgotten Prince can take the Hide action.

reaction.name: Shadow Burst
entries: {@actTrigger} The Forgotten Prince is reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. {@actResponse} Creatures within 15 feet take 36 ({@damage 8d8}) Necrotic damage.

legendary.name: Dark Scythe
entries: The Forgotten Prince makes one Dark Scythe attack.

legendary.name: Fey Step
entries: The Forgotten Prince uses Fey Step.

legendary.name: Marked for Vengeance
entries: The Forgotten Prince uses Spellcasting to cast {@spell Hex|XPHB} (level 5 version).

spellcasting.name: Etherealness
headerEntries: The meld cast the {@spell Etherealness|XPHB} spell, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability. The meld is visible on the Material Plane while on the Border Ethereal and vice versa, but it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

trait.name: Ethereal Sight
entries: The meld can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane and vice versa.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The meld can move through other creatures and objects as if they were {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) Force damage if it ends its turn inside an object. The meld can also interact with any liquid surface as if it was solid ground.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The meld makes four Withering Slam attacks. It can replace two attacks with a use of Conflicted Soul.

action.name: Withering Slam
entries: {@atk m} +7, reach 10 ft. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) Necrotic damage.

action.name: Conflicted Soul
entries: {@actSave cha} {@dc 14}, one creature the meld can see within 30 feet. {@actSaveFail} The target suffers the effect of the {@spell Confusion|XPHB} spell (no {@status Concentration|XPHB} required to maintain the spell).

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The merfolk casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 14}):

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The merfolk can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Summon Storm
entries: Once per day, one or more merfolk stormcallers can cast {@spell Control Weather|XPHB} as a {@variantrule Ritual|XPHB} that takes 10 minutes to perform. For every additional stormcaller involved in performing the {@variantrule Ritual|XPHB}, the radius of the spell's effect increases by 1 mile, the duration increases by 2 hours, and they can change the weather by one additional stage every {@dice 1d4 x 10} minutes. During the casting, if the stormcallers take any action other than performing the {@variantrule Ritual|XPHB}, they must start over.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The stormcaller makes three Lightning Lash attacks.

action.name: Lightning Lash
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 6}, reach 15 ft. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) Lightning damage.

reaction.name: Thunderous Rebuke
entries: {@actTrigger} A creature within 60 feet of the merfolk deals damage to it. {@actResponse d}{@actSave con} {@dc 14}, the triggering creature. {@actSaveFail} 11 ({@damage 2d10}) Thunder damage, and the target has the {@condition Prone|XPHB} condition.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The quori casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 16}):

trait.name: All-Around Vision
entries: The quori can't be {@status surprised|XPHB} while it isn't {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB}.

trait.name: Aura of Fury
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 16}, any creature that starts its turn in a 60-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from the quori. {@actSaveFail} The target becomes enraged. While enraged, the target has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on all melee attack rolls, and all attack rolls made against the target have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The quori has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Track Hatred
entries: When the quori deals damage to any creature, it forms a psychic link with the target for 24 hours. During that time, the quori has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Survival|XPHB}) checks to track the target. The quori can attempt to track the target at any range, even if it is on another plane of existence. Abilities such as the {@spell Pass Without Trace|XPHB} spell or the Ranger's Nature's Veil feature do not impede the quori's ability to track its target. The quori remains alert to danger even when it is tracking while traveling.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The quori makes three Tentacle attacks.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 9}, reach 10 ft. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) Bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) Fire damage, and the target has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 17}) from one of three tentacles. While {@condition Grappled|XPHB}, the target takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Fire damage and 10 ({@damage 3d6}) Psychic damage at the start of each of the quori's turns.

action.name: Possession {@recharge}
entries: {@actSave cha} {@dc 16}, one Humanoid the quori can see within 5 feet. {@actSaveFail} The target is possessed by the quori; the quori disappears and the target has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition and loses control of its body. The quori now controls the body, but the target retains awareness. The quori can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, except ones that specifically target Aberrations. The quori's game statistics are the same, except it uses the possessed target's {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}, as well as the target's Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution modifiers.

The possession lasts until the body drops to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} or the quori leaves as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}. When the possession ends, the quori appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the target, and the target is immune to this quori's {@variantrule Possession|XPHB} for 24 hours. {@actSaveSuccess} The target is immune to this quori's {@variantrule Possession|XPHB} for 24 hours.

action.name: Recall Agony {@recharge 5}
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 16}, one creature the quori can see within 60 feet. {@actSaveFail} 67 ({@damage 15d8}) Psychic damage. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage.

reaction.name: Incite Fury
entries: {@actTrigger} A creature under the effects of the quori's Aura of Fury targets the quori with an attack. {@actResponse} The target attacks another creature of the quori's choice within the targets range.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The sahuagin casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 16}):

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The sahuagin has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

trait.name: Limited Amphibiousness
entries: The sahuagin can breathe air and water, but it must be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating outside water.

trait.name: Shark Telepathy
entries: The sahuagin can magically control sharks within 120 feet of itself, using a special telepathy.

trait.name: Toughened Carapace
entries: Any {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} against the sahuagin becomes a normal hit.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sahuagin makes three attacks, using Crushing Claw or Cutter Claw in any combination. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Crushing Claw
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 9}, reach 10 ft. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) Bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it has the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition (escape {@dc 15}) from the Crushing Claw.

action.name: Cutter Claw
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 9}, reach 10 ft. {@h}24 ({@damage 3d12 + 5}) Slashing damage.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The plasmid can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Receptive Telepathy
entries: The plasmid is considered a shark for the purpose of being magically controlled by any sahuagin's Shark {@variantrule Telepathy|XPHB} trait.

trait.name: Solid State (Object Form Only)
entries: When formed into an inanimate object, the plasmid has an AC of 18 and regains 10 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} at the start of each of its turns. However, the plasmid's {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} becomes 0 in this form and it cannot attack. It can be used as an item or a set of Artisan's Tools when it is in this form.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The plasmid makes three Vicious Pseudopod attacks.

action.name: Vicious Pseudopod
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 6}, reach 10 ft. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) Slashing damage.

action.name: Adaptive Shape-Shift (Amorphous Form Only)
entries: When in its true, amorphous form, the plasmid gains one of the following benefits until it uses this action again:

items.name: Truesight
entries: The plasmid gains Truesight with a range of 30 feet.

items.name: Blindsight
entries: The plasmid gains Blindsight with a range of 60 feet.

items.name: Speed
entries: The plasmid's {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} and {@variantrule Swim Speed|XPHB} increase to 30 feet.

items.name: Extra Damage
entries: The plasmid's Vicious Pseudopod deals an extra {@damage 1d6} Acid damage on a hit.

bonus.name: Shape-Shift
entries: The plasmid shape-shifts to resemble a Medium or Small object while retaining its game statistics, or it returns to its true amorphous form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

spell.name: Aundair's Silent Sanctum
entries: You surround yourself with an invisible bubble of energy in a 5-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation}. The sphere muffles sound in both directions. Creatures outside of the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB}) checks made to hear any sounds from within the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation}, and creatures inside the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB} on Wisdom ({@skill Perception|XPHB}) checks made to hear sounds outside of the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation}.

In addition, creatures have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws against effects that require them to hear a sound from the other side of the {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation}, such as the {@spell Command|XPHB} spell.

spell.name: Concussive Burst
entries: A pulse of energy ripples through the air at a point you choose within range, dealing minor damage over a wide area. Each creature within a 20-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} centered on that point makes a Constitution saving throw, taking {@damage 2d4} Force damage on a failed save and has the {@condition Deafened|XPHB} condition until the end of your next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage only.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Using a Higher-Level Spell Slot
entries: The damage increases by {@dice 2d4} for each spell slot level above 1.

spell.name: Force Blast
entries: You unleash a bolt of mystical power at a creature or an object within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} Force damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cantrip Upgrade
entries: This damage increases by {@dice 1d8} when you reach levels 5 ({@dice 2d8}), 11 ({@dice 3d8}), and 17 ({@dice 4d8}).

spell.name: Magecraft

components.m: a set of Artisan's Tools or a Herbalism Kit

entries: You channel your arcane talent through a set of tools. Choose an {@item Artisan's Tools|XPHB|Artisan Tool} or {@item Herbalism Kit|XPHB}. Until the spell ends, you add {@dice 1d6} to ability checks you make when you take the {@action Utilize|XPHB} action with the chosen tool.

items.name: Fernian Resistance
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Fire damage and Necrotic damage.

items.name: Flame Bearer
entries: You know the {@spell Produce Flame|XPHB} cantrip. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell (choose the ability when you select this species).

items.name: Celestial Revelation
entries: When you reach character level 3, you can transform as a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} using one of the options below (choose the option each time you transform). The transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it (no action required). Once you transform, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

Once on each of your turns before the transformation ends, you can deal extra damage to one target when you deal damage to it with an attack or a spell. The extra damage equals your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, and the extra damage's type is either Necrotic for Necrotic Shroud or Radiant for Heavenly Wings and Inner Darkness.
Here are the transformation options:

items.name: Heavenly Wings
entries: Two spectral wings sprout from your back temporarily. Until the transformation ends, you have a {@variantrule Fly Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.

items.name: Inner Darkness
entries: You consume light and life, creating a shroud of shadows. For the duration, you reduce {@variantrule Bright Light|XPHB} in a 20-foot radius to {@variantrule Dim Light|XPHB}, and at the end of each of your turns, each creature within 10 feet of you takes Necrotic damage equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}.

items.name: Necrotic Shroud
entries: Your eyes briefly become pools of darkness, and flightless wings sprout from your back temporarily. Creatures other than your allies within 10 feet of you must succeed on a Charisma saving throw ({@dc 8} plus your Charisma modifier and {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}) or have the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the end of your next turn.

items.name: Herald of Death
entries: You know the {@spell Toll The Dead|XPHB} cantrip. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell (choose the ability when you select this species).

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You have {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 60 feet.

entries.name: Discipline
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws you make to avoid or end the Charmed condition.

entries.name: Strength in Unity
entries: If you fail a {@variantrule D20 Test|XPHB}, you can gain a bonus to the roll equal to the number of allies you can see within 30 feet of you (maximum bonus of +5). Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: War and Peace
entries: You gain proficiency in two of the following skills: {@skill Athletics|XPHB}, {@skill History|XPHB}, {@skill Intimidation|XPHB}, {@skill Performance|XPHB}.

Dhakaani hobgoblins are known as ghaal'dar, "mighty folk"—not to be confused with the Ghaal'dar tribes that dominate Darguun. The ghaal'dar are soldiers, scholars, and leaders, valued for their versatility and their vision.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You have {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 60 feet.

entries.name: Discipline
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws you make to avoid or end the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition.

entries.name: Naturally Stealthy
entries: You can take the {@action Hide|XPHB} action even when you are obscured only by a creature that is at least one size larger than you.

entries.name: Nimbleness
entries: You can move through the space of any creature that is a size larger than you, but you can't stop in the same space.

Dhakaani goblins are known as golin'dar, "quick folk." They reproduce and mature faster than other dar, and form the bulk of the labor force in Dhakaani society. This includes menial labor, agriculture, food preparation, and skilled craftwork. Though ghaal'dar are the primary smiths of weapons and armor, most other manufacturing is done by the golin'dar. While this work may be less dramatic than the martial paths of the ghaal'dar and guul'dar, it's vital to survival and the golin'dar are respected for their contributions. Other golin'dar take a different path, that of the Khesh'dar, the Silent Folk who live in the shadows of the empire.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You have {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 60 feet.

entries.name: Brave
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws you make to avoid or end the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition.

entries.name: Long-Limbed
entries: When you make a melee attack on your turn, your reach for it is 5 feet greater than normal.

entries.name: Powerful Build
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on any ability check you make to end the {@condition Grappled|XPHB} condition. You also count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity.

entries.name: Stand by the Strong
entries: When an ally within 30 feet that can see you fails a saving throw to avoid or end the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition, you can use your {@variantrule Reaction|XPHB} to allow them to reroll the saving throw.

Dhakaani bugbears are known as guul'dar, "strong folk," and are celebrated for their strength and courage. They help perform heavy labor where strength is required, but most yearn to prove their mettle on the battlefield, risking their lives to earn the glory known as atcha.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You have {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 60 feet.

entries.name: Bite
entries: Your teeth are natural weapons, which you can use to make {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB|Unarmed Strikes}. If you hit with them, you deal Piercing damage equal to {@dice 1d6} plus your Strength modifier in place of the normal Bludgeoning damage of your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}.

entries.name: Hunter's Senses
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Perception|XPHB}, {@skill Stealth|XPHB}, or {@skill Survival|XPHB} skill.

entries.name: Rampage
entries: When you use your Bite or reduce a creature to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} with an attack, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to move up to half your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} and make one attack with a weapon or an {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} using your Bite.

Fierce and feral, the first gnolls were hyenas infused with malefic power by archfiends of war and the wild. They were created as cruel soldiers to serve in the endless conflicts of fiends, but over the course of countless generations a number of gnoll clans broke their ties to their demon overlords. These free gnolls are fiercely loyal to their pack and their clan, and serve as a stabilizing force within Droaam.

Gnolls that are bound to the overlords are vicious and wild. Those who have escaped this bondage still have a fiendish spark within, but they contain and control this power. Some learn to wield it as Warlocks. Others known as hwyri train to fight demons and other supernatural threats. Even free gnolls can be aggressive, but they are gifted hunters and fiercely loyal to those they choose as family.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You have {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 60 feet.

entries.name: Relentless Endurance
entries: When you are reduced to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB} but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB|Hit Point} instead. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Versatile
entries: You gain an {@filter Origin feat|feats|category=o} of your choice.

Long ago, the orcs of the Shadow Marches welcomed human refugees from Sarlona. The two species have lived together in harmony for centuries. Most humans or orcs from the Marches have some degree of mixed lineage, even though they may use the game statistics of the species they outwardly resemble. However, the union of human and orc can produce children who have physical traits of both parent species. In the Shadow Marches, such people are called Jhorgun'taal, "children of two bloods"; they are celebrated as a symbol of the bond between orcs and humans. Jhorgun'taal blend the endurance of their orc ancestors with the flexibility of humanity.

As House Tharashk has spread across Khorvaire, Jhorgun'taal are often found as inquisitives, bounty hunters, and prospectors. The Mark of Finding can manifest on humans, orcs, or Jhorgun'taal who can trace their ancestry to the Shadow Marches.

entries.name: Size:
entries: Medium (about 4-7 feet tall) or Small (about 2-4 feet tall), chosen when you select this species

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You have {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 120 feet.

entries.name: Personal Symbiont
entries: You are bound to an alien entity that is part of your body and can't be removed. Your symbiont possesses a minor supernatural ability, which it can use on your behalf. Choose a cantrip from the following list: {@spell Acid Splash|XPHB}, {@spell Guidance|XPHB} (self only), {@spell Light|XPHB}, {@spell Mage Hand|XPHB}, {@spell Mind Slive|XPHB}, {@spell Poison Spray|XPHB}, {@spell Resistance|XPHB} (self only), {@spell Shocking Grasp|XPHB}, {@spell Thorn Whip|XPHB}. You can switch to a different cantrip from this list whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for the spells you cast with this trait (choose the ability when you select this species).

entries.name: Symbiont Mastery
entries: You can attune to one magic item that has the Symbiotic Nature property without it counting toward the maximum number of magic items you can attune to. In addition, whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, you can end your {@variantrule Attunement|XPHB} to a magic item that has the Symbiotic Nature property. When doing so, you can ignore any restrictions that require you be targeted by a {@spell Remove Curse|XPHB} spell or similar magic before the symbiont can be removed.

entries.name: Unnatural Resilience
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Poison damage. You also have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws you make to avoid or end the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition.

entries.caption: Ruinbound Mutations
rows: {@b Unnatural Hair.} Is your hair an unusual color? Ectoplasmic in nature? Does it move of its own accord?
{@b Unusual Skin.} Is your skin transparent? Slick? An unnatural color?
{@b Aberrant Eyes.} Are your eyes luminous? Invisible? Do they resemble the eyes of an animal, or are they seemingly absent?
{@b Strange Appetites.} Do you prefer your food charred? Do you eat flowers, or can you only eat living things?

{@b Living Tattoos.} You appear to have exotic tattoos across your body. They slowly and constantly change, and you have no control over the design. Do they show images or words, or are they incomprehensible?

{@b Ageless.} The passage of time affects your appearance differently than others. Do you appear old beyond your years, or look surprisingly young no matter your age? As you grow older, do you look younger?
{@b Inexplicable Hearing.} You have no visible ears, yet you can hear clearly. Does sound feel different to you? How do you experience it?
{@b Extra Joints.} You have one or more extra joints. Is it just an unusual joint in your fingers, or can you bend your entire leg backward?

entries: The Ruinbound are mutants that can be born to any humanoid species that has contact with the Daelkyr or their minions. A Ruinbound is born with a personal symbiont—an unnatural entity bound to the child. Unlike most symbionts, this entity cannot be separated from its host, and the two are permanently fused. Many Ruinbound have additional disturbing mutations; you can roll on the Ruinbound Mutations table for ideas, or create your own. These secondary mutations are disturbing, but they don't change the rules of how that character is played or grant mechanical benefits. For example, even if a Ruinbound seems to have no eyes, their vision uncannily works as well as any other member of their species, though it defies logic.

Aside from their mutations, Ruinbound share the appearance of their parent species. The Mror Holds have seen a surge of Ruinbound births since the War Below began, and there have always been Ruinbound orcs and humans in the Shadow Marches. Even in these places, however, the Ruinbound are rare and remarkable, and generally don't pass their traits on to their offspring. More information about the Ruinbound can be found in the Mror Holds section of Uncharted Domains.

When making a Ruinbound character, work with your DM to determine the appearance of your Personal Symbiont. It is organic and clearly alien, and when you cast a cantrip with this trait, it should be obvious that the symbiont is the source. A symbiont that casts {@spell Mage Hand|XPHB} could be a thin tentacle or an ectoplasmic insect that emerges from your body and performs the action. An eyestalk protruding from your shoulder could grant you Guidance as it studies the situation and telepathically advises you—or it might blast your enemies with a {@spell Mind Sliver|XPHB}.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You have {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 120 feet.

entries.name: Swift Swimmer
entries: You have a Swim speed equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.

entries.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: As a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB}, you can enter a blood frenzy for 1 minute. During this time, you have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

You can use this {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} a number of times equal to your {@variantrule Proficiency|XPHB|Proficiency Bonus}, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

entries.name: Natural Armor
entries: You have tough, scaly skin. When you aren't wearing any armor, your base {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB} equals 12 plus your Dexterity modifier. You can use a {@item Shield|XPHB} and still gain this benefit.

entries.name: Limited Amphibiousness
entries: You can breathe air and underwater, but you need to be submerged at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

The sahuagin are an ancient species spawned in the ocean depths. With their armored skin and fearsome demeanor, they have long inspired terror in the people of the surface world. They are natural predators with aggressive instincts, kin to the shark and often devotees of the Devourer. But there is nothing innately evil about most sahuagin; in the depths of the Thunder Sea, sahuagin champions battle fiends and aberrations.

Sahuagin are amphibious humanoids with leathery skin, sharp teeth, and webbed hands and feet. They have finlike crests on their heads, which extend and retract in response to their mood. While the majority of sahuagin have gray-green scales, others have scales with dramatic, colorful patterns.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You have {@sense Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 60 feet.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries: You can breathe air and water.

entries.name: Blessing of the Sea
entries: You have two forms: your natural merfolk form and that of a landwalker. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can shape-shift to change from your merfolk form to your landwalker form. While in your landwalker form, your fish-like fluke splits into 2 legs. Your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} increases by 20 feet, but your {@variantrule Swim Speed|XPHB} is reduced to 0.
You stay in the new form until you take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to revert to your merfolk form.

entries.name: Karakala Lore
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Nature|XPHB}, {@skill Performance|XPHB}, or {@skill Survival|XPHB} skill.

The Kalamer merfolk dwell in the Thunder Sea, and most spend their entire lives beneath the waves. However, a few are called to walk above the water. Those that embrace this path may become Kalamer Landwalkers, gaining the magical ability to transform their fish-tail into a pair of humanoid legs. Landwalkers are exceptionally rare, and few surface-dwellers have ever seen one. Some Kalamer Landwalkers feel a call to accomplish a specific goal, fulfilling a mission for the good of the world. Others are driven purely by curiosity, and yearn to see new places and find wondrous things.

raceFluff.name: Aasimar (Fernian)
entries: If your Aasimar's powers flow from Fernia, you are infused with otherworldly fire.

raceFluff.name: Aasimar (Mabaran)
entries: If your Aasimar's powers are drawn from Mabar, you are bound to shadows and despair.

feat.name: Aereni Expertise
entries: Growing up in Aerenal, you spent decades developing your talent with one particular skill. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Skill Proficiency
entries: You gain proficiency in one skill of your choice.

entries.name: Expertise
entries: You gain {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB} with the skill you selected for this feat.

feat.name: Aquatic Adaptation
entries: You are able to live underwater. This may be a natural feature of your character if you're playing a Malenti or an Elf from Valraea, or it could be the result of arcane transmutation or a divine blessing. Whatever the origin of this gift, you gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Amphibious
entries: You can breathe underwater. If you possess the Limited Amphibiousness trait in addition to this feat, this eliminates your dependence on water.

entries.name: Athletic Build
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Athletics|XPHB} skill.

entries.name: Natural Swimmer
entries: You have a {@variantrule Swim Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.

feat.name: Envoy Specialist
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Envoy Competence
entries: You gain proficiency with one tool of your choice.

entries.name: Integrated Tool
entries: Choose one tool you are proficient with. You have a working model of this tool integrated into your body, which can't be removed. As long as you have a hand free, you can make use of the integrated tool.

entries.name: Innate Talent
entries: When you make an ability check with the integrated tool, you can roll {@dice 1d4} and add the number rolled to the ability check.

feat.name: Khesh'dar Training
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Swift and Silent
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Stealth|XPHB} skill.

entries.name: Master of Shadows
entries: You gain {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB} with the {@skill Stealth|XPHB} skill.

entries.name: Fade Away
entries: When you take the {@action Hide|XPHB} action, the DC for a successful check is reduced to 10. All other restrictions still apply.

feat.name: Focused Personas
entries: You've developed personas that help you focus your talents. Work with your DM to define two unique personas—identities with distinct appearances and personalities. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Adept Persona
entries: Choose a tool and define a persona associated with it. Whenever you use your Shape-Shifter trait to assume the persona, you gain proficiency with the chosen tool and when you make an ability check with the chosen tool, you can roll {@dice 1d4} and add the number rolled to the ability check.

entries.name: Expert Persona
entries: Choose a skill you are proficient in and define a different persona associated with it. Whenever you use your Shape-Shifter trait to assume the persona, you gain {@variantrule Expertise|XPHB} in the chosen skill.

entries.name: Skin Cant
entries: You are fluent in Skin Cant, a language used by the Changeling Travelers.

feat.name: Thoughtsinger
entries: You have honed your telepathic abilities, allowing you to link to and guide your companions as a united group. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Superior Telepathy
entries: The telepathy granted by your Mind Link trait has a range of 120 feet or 10 times your level, whichever is higher.

entries.name: Thoughtsong
entries: When you use your Mind Link trait to grant a creature the ability to speak to you telepathically, you form a mental connection with that individual. When you communicate telepathically, you may choose to send the message to all creatures you currently have a mental connection to. You may also allow those creatures to speak telepathically with one another. These effects last for as long as the Mind Link remains in effect.

entries.name: Telepathic Aid
entries: If you can speak telepathically to an ally using your Mind Link trait, you can take the {@action Help|XPHB} action to aid them in attacking a creature, even if you are more than 5 feet away from them.

feat.name: Uul Dhakaan
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Dreamwalker
entries: You remain fully lucid when you dream and when you wake, you clearly remember everything that transpired.

entries.name: Mentor in the Uul
entries: There is a spirit in the Uul Dhakaan that serves as your mentor. Work with your DM to develop the identity of this spirit; they could be the memory of an ancestor or fallen hero, or a living uul'kala bard. Whenever you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}, there's a chance you'll receive a vision, a mission, or a clue about your current situation.

entries.name: Shielded by Dreams
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Psychic damage.

feat.name: Aereni Half-Life
entries: You've undergone rituals that bind you to Irian and the Undying Court. Many who undergo this process have a desiccated appearance, similar to a mummy; it's up to you to decide whether you are affected in this way. Regardless of your appearance, you gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Deathless
entries: You have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on {@variantrule Death Saving Throw|XPHB|Death Saving Throws}.

entries.name: Resistance
entries: You have {@variantrule Resistance|XPHB} to Necrotic damage and Radiant damage.

entries.name: Radiant Focus
entries: If you cast a spell that deals Necrotic damage, you can choose to have it inflict Radiant damage instead.

feat.name: Changeling Metamorphosis
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Hardened Skin
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to {@variantrule Armor Class|XPHB}.

entries.name: Metamorphosis
entries: When you use your Shape-Shifter trait, you may choose one of the following options. You gain the benefits of the chosen option until you use your Shape-Shifter trait again.

entries.name: Aquatic Adaptation
entries: You sprout gills and grow webs between your fingers. You can breathe underwater and gain a {@variantrule Swim Speed|XPHB} equal to your {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You have {@spell Darkvision|XPHB} with a range of 60 feet.

entries.name: Natural Weapons
entries: You grow claws (Slashing), fangs (Piercing), horns (Piercing), or hooves (Bludgeoning). When you use your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB} to deal damage with that new growth, it deals {@damage 1d6} damage of the type in parentheses instead of dealing the normal damage for your {@variantrule Unarmed Strike|XPHB}, and you can choose to use your Dexterity modifier for the attack and damage rolls rather than using Strength.

feat.name: Juggernaut Plating
entries: You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Resilient Armor
entries: While you remain alive, armor you have donned can't be targeted by any effect (such as the {@spell Heat Metal|XPHB} spell or the antennae of a rust monster) against your will.

entries.name: Adamantine Body
entries: Any {@variantrule Critical Hit|XPHB} against you becomes a normal hit.

feat.name: Superior Shifting
entries: You have a potent connection to the beast within, strengthening your body and your ability to shift. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Shifting Endurance
entries: At the start of your turn, you can use your Shifting trait (no action required). The transformation now lasts 10 minutes.

entries.name: Shifter Recovery
entries: You can use your Shifting trait one additional time. You regain 1 expended use when you finish a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB}, and all expended uses when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

feat.name: Quori Bond
entries: You possess a particularly strong bond with your quori spirit. You gain the following benefits.

entries.name: Quori Lineage
entries: Choose a lineage from the Quori Lineages table. Your choice affects the {@variantrule Skill|XPHB} and Spell sections detailed below.

entries.name: Skill
entries: When you make an ability check with the skill associated with your quori lineage, you can roll {@dice 1d4} and add the number rolled to the ability check.

entries.name: Spell
entries: You always have the spell associated with your quori lineage prepared. You can cast it once without a spell slot, and you regain the ability to cast it in that way when you finish a {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level. Your spellcasting ability for the spell is the ability increased by this feat.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) 2 {@item Dagger|XPHB|Daggers}, {@item Thieves' Tools|XPHB}, {@item Bedroll|XPHB}, 2 {@item Pouch|XPHB|Pouches}, Shiftweave clothing, 10 GP; or (B) 50 GP

entries: You're an urban nomad wandering from city to city. You spent your childhood traveling with your family, using your abilities to evade your enemies. Do you strive to be a force for positive change in the world, or are you an opportunist looking out for yourself? Most Changeling Travelers are Changelings. If you're not a Changeling, you were born to a changeling parent and traveled with them; you could use a Disguise Kit or illusion magic to mimic their abilities.

a.special: The equipment of a background related to the person you consumed

items.name: Tool Proficiencies:
items.entry: Choose {@item Thieves' Tools|XPHB}, {@item Poisoner's Kit|XPHB}, or {@item Forgery Kit|XPHB}

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) The equipment of a background related to the person you consumed; or (B) 50 GP

entries: You were born a sahuagin in the Eternal Dominion of the Thunder Sea, but ritual magic and the blood of the kar'lassa allowed you to consume and replace a surface dweller. You can never regain your original form; for all intents and purposes, you are who you appear to be. You're physically indistinguishable from them, and you have enough of their memories to fool even their family and friends. But you have the mind of a sahuagin, and you're loyal to the Dominion.

As a Malenti, the first question is why the Dominion chose to replace this particular person, and how your mission relates to your activities as an adventurer. It's possible that your only mission is to observe the dryskins and occasionally provide information to a sahuagin spymaster, or you might have a specific goal that drives your actions during your adventures.

items.name: Tool Proficiency:
items.entry: Choose one kind of {@item Artisan's Tools|XPHB}

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Artisan's Tools|XPHB} (same as above), 2 {@item Pouch|XPHB|Pouches}, {@item Traveler's Clothes|XPHB}, 32 GP; or (B) 50 GP

entries: You worked your way up in House Cannith or the Arcane Congress, studying at a trade school and working in an industrial forgehold. While you've abandoned the factory in favor of adventure, you still have strong ties in the Fabricator's Guild.

items.name: Tool Proficiency:
items.entry: Choose one kind of {@item Gaming Set|XPHB}

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Spear|XPHB}, {@item Shortbow|XPHB}, {@item Arrow|XPHB|20 Arrows}, {@item Gaming Set|XPHB} (same as above), {@item Healer's Kit|XPHB}, {@item Quiver|XPHB}, {@item Traveler's Clothes|XPHB}, 14 GP; or (B) 50 GP

entries: You operated and maintained the engines of war. What nation did you serve? Are you proud of your service, or haunted by your deeds? Did you serve and retire with distinctionor are you a folk hero who deserted to help innocents?

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Quarterstaff|XPHB}, {@item Calligrapher's Supplies|XPHB}, {@item Book|XPHB} (history), {@item Parchment|XPHB} (8 sheets), {@item Robe|XPHB}, 8 GP; or (B) 50 GP

entries: You don't do well with authority. You may have started with Arcanix or the Twelve, but you were thrown out after challenging the system one too many times. You're brilliantbut determined to find your own path.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Dagger|XPHB|2 Daggers}, {@item Thieves' Tools|XPHB}, {@item Gaming Set|XPHB} (any), {@item Bedroll|XPHB}, {@item Pouch|XPHB|2 Pouches}, {@item Traveler's Clothes|XPHB}, 16 GP; or (B) 50 GP

entries: You've never studied arcane science, but you have an intuitive talent for artifice. Perhaps you grew up on battlefields, scavenging parts from warforged titans or shattered floating fortresses. Your work isn't pretty—and often seems like it shouldn't work—yet you can do things no magewright can match.

items.name: Equipment:
items.entry: Choose A or B: (A) {@item Dagger|XPHB|2 Daggers}, {@item Thieves' Tools|XPHB}, {@item Crowbar|XPHB}, {@item Pouch|XPHB|2 Pouches}, {@item Traveler's Clothes|XPHB}, 16 GP; or (B) 50 GP

entries: You provided arcane assistance to an organization operating out of the public eye. Did you serve with the Royal Eyes of Aundair or the King's Citadel of Breland, crafting Common items for agents? Or was it a shadier operation like the Boromar Clan or House Tarkanan? Why did you shift to a life of adventure? What pieces of your old life could come back to haunt you?

item.name: Battle Rod
entries: The Battle Rod was developed as an alternative to the longer {@item War Staff|ExploringEberron24}, and has gained popularity with wandslingers across Khorvaire. When held in two hands, you can use the rod to cast cantrips at up to twice the standard range. However, when you cast a cantrip beyond the standard range, your attack rolls have {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB}, and targets have {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on saving throws made against your cantrip. For example, a Fire Bolt cast using this rod has a range of 240 feet, but attack rolls against targets more than 120 feet away are made at {@variantrule Disadvantage|XPHB}.

item.name: Charlatan's Gloves
entries: While wearing these gloves, you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to produce an illusory image that fits in the palm of your hand. The image lasts for 1 minute or until your {@status Concentration|XPHB} ends (as if you were {@status Concentration|XPHB|Concentrating} on a spell). The image can't create sound, light, smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, because things can pass through it.

If a creature takes a {@action Study|XPHB} action to examine the image, the creature can determine that it is an illusion with a successful Intelligence ({@skill Investigation|XPHB}) check contested by your Charisma ({@skill Deception|XPHB}) check. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the illusion becomes faint to the creature.

item.name: Drybrooch
entries: While holding or wearing this item, you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to summon or dismiss a dome of energy that manifests just above your head. This energy repels moderate quantities of {@condition frozen|MonstersOfDrakkenheim} and liquid water, such as rain, snow, bird droppings, or other similar nuisances, but can't be used to protect against harsh environmental hazards or attacks. The energy field is typically silvery and translucent. More expensive models have illusions woven into the field; one popular version creates the image of a sunny blue sky overhead.

item.name: Duster
entries: While holding this wand, you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to instantly clean an area within 10 feet of you that is no larger than 1 cubic foot, removing dirt and grime. There are many variations of the Duster; the two-handed Staff of Cleansing covers a five-foot cube with a single {@action Magic|XPHB} action, while the Bright Basin cleans clothing and cloth objects placed within it.

item.name: Integrated Tool
entries: This item attaches to the body of a warforged, and is designed to serve as one of the following tools that weighs 10 pounds or less: an Artisan's Tool, {@item Forgery Kit|XPHB}, {@item Herbalism Kit|XPHB}, {@item Poisoner's Kit|XPHB}, {@item Thieves' Tools|XPHB}, or a {@item Musical Instrument|XPHB}.

You must incorporate the tool into your body before you can use it. Over the course of 1 hour, you can attach the tool or remove it from your body, remaining in contact with it for the whole hour; this can be done over a {@variantrule Short Rest|XPHB|Short} or {@variantrule Long Rest|XPHB}.

While you're alive, the tool can't be removed from your body against your will. Though the tool has become part of your body, you must still have a hand free to make use of it. You can only have one Integrated Tool attached to your body at a time.

item.name: Lamplighter
entries: While you are holding this wand, you can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to instantaneously light or snuff out a candle, torch, small campfire, or similar source of flame within 10 feet of you.

item.name: Spark
entries: This small oval stone is engraved with Fernian glyphs. While you are holding the stone, you can take a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} to touch a candle, torch, small campfire, or similar object, instantly igniting it into flame.

item.name: Talking Wand
entries: While you are holding this wand, your voice and other sounds you produce are three times as loud as normal. House Phiarlan makes use of a similar device, the Thunderous Amulet, that leaves the wearer's hands free.

item.name: Thurimbar Rod
entries: This rod is a magical {@item Musical Instrument|XPHB} developed by the gnomes of Zilargo.
